intro: Joseanthus cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas' joseanthus, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
